urls.title: McRibs, Warriors and Nets
urls.description: Notorious podcaster Sam Esfandiari stops by to help taste test the McRib, understand why the Warriors aren’t looking so mighty, and unpack the mess that is the Brooklyn Nets.

data.text:
Story on Brooklyn’s coaching change filed to @YahooSports, and pubbing shortly. 

Then, we’ll have @samesfandiari on @getcallin at 4ET, to discuss the Nets’ drama, why the Warriors are struggling, and… wish goodbye to the McRib. 

https://t.co/EZajf203z4

There were rumblings yesterday about Steve Nash's tenure in Brooklyn, should the Nets have lost to Indiana last nite. The victory, Nash's enthusiasm on the sidelines, a second game of a back-to-back in a few hours... this ain't exactly a shock, but timing is certainly a surprise.

urls.title: How Tyrese Haliburton is embracing his role as Pacers franchise cornerstone
urls.description: Indiana's third-year guard is taking an active role in shaping the franchise's future.

data.text:
The Pacers value Tyrese Haliburton’s mind for the passing lanes it processes and the person it has shaped. He can modify video games, launch a Web3 podcast, and joined Indiana’s free agency meeting with Deandre Ayton. 

“They have handed him the keys.”

urls.title: PODCAST: NBA reporter Jake Fischer on leaguewide issues, lessons from The Process, and the present Pacers
urls.description: Jake covers the NBA for Yahoo Sports. He discusses the league's troubling start, covering The Process in Philly, Pacers-Lakers trade considerations and the pursuit of Deandre Ayton.

urls.title: NBA reporter Jake Fischer on leaguewide issues, lessons from The Process, and the present Pacers
urls.description: Listen to this episode from Fieldhouse Files: Scott Agness on the Indiana Pacers on Spotify. On this episode of the Fieldhouse Files, I’m bringing in a national perspective. I’m joined by Jake Fischer, senior NBA reporter for Yahoo Sports. Among the items discussed on this episode: Jake on how attention and storylines are all on issues off from the court (5:38) His takeaways from The Process after starting on the 76ers beat with Liberty Ballers (11:30) The key for the Pacers and other teams amidst a rebuild (16:45) Pacers being all-in on Tyrese Haliburton — and his maturity (23:10) Why would the Pacers want to deal with the Lakers? (26:20) Pacers’ pursuit of Deandre Ayton (33:00) ----- Follow Scott on Twitter and Instagram, and read his work on fieldhousefiles.com.

urls.description: The Celtics guard thought Udoka would someday return to the Celtics' bench rather than be hired by a rival only two months into his suspension.

tweets.text:

I spoke w/Marcus Smart, who's not pleased.
